alert.note: Alert for Snyder (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 11:08AM EDT until July 09 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Columbia, Dauphin, Juniata, Montour, Northumberland, Perry and Snyder. * WHEN...Until 200 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1108 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in Millerstown. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Millerstown is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall of 1 to 3 inches is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sunbury, Shamokin, Mount Carmel, Selinsgrove, Danville, Kulpmont, Elysburg, Fairview-Ferndale, Riverside, Trevorton, Shamokin Dam, Marshallton, Hummels Wharf, Port Trevorton, Richfield, Mount Pleasant Mills, Mechanicsville, Wilburton Number One, Locustdale and Klingerstown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
